definitions.text: causing fear or dread or terror
examples: a career or vengeance so direful that London was shocked
the dread presence of the headmaster
polio is no longer the dreaded disease it once was

definitions.text: lacking courage; ignobly timid and faint-hearted; - P.B.Shelley
examples: cowardly dogs, ye will not aid me then

definitions.text: timid by nature or revealing timidity
examples: cast fearful glances at the large dog
